results.title: EC, Poss & Kim
results.creator_credit: Colin Budds, Mario Andreacchio, Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories from the popular series about the doll, EC and the two little girls, Poss and Kim. “Going under”: Kim is pushed under at the pool and is helped to face her fear of water. “Fun Day”: Poss and Kim have tickets to the fun park. “Growing up”: Kim overcomes her fears at the gym. “True friend”: Poss comes to understand true friendship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Budds, Mario Andreacchio, Steve Steve Jodrell, Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: The Story of EC
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories that tell how EC came to live with Nipper Poss and Kim. “A Load of old rubbish”: A scruffy old doll called EC falls off a dump truck and is rescued and cleaned by Poss and Kim. “Out of order”: Nipper loses EC in the rain and EC disappears down the drain. “Clash”: Poss and Kim argue over EC’s role in a game and pull the doll apart. “Destroy”: Nipper thinks he is too old for dolls and tries to reject EC.

results.title: East of Eden
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: It is 1917, just before the United States’ entry into World War I and two brothers are graduating from High School at a time of great social change. James Dean gives a powerful performance as Cal, rebelling against his farmer father and slowly coming to grips with the secrets and betrayals his family have kept from him. Using biblical metaphors and Freudian symbolism Kazan delivers a hard-hitting and emotionally intense drama based on the latter half of John Steinbeck’s novel. Though Dean’s performance as the psychologically scarred son stands out, other performers such as Burl Ives, Julie Harris and Jo Van Fleet are equally fine.

results.title: Earthware
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Richard Raxlen, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This short impressionistic film takes us to Nigeria, Japan, Mexico where craftsmen work clay to produce ritual vessels and everyday objects. Film without words.

results.title: Earthquake! (PC)
results.brief_description: Witness the devastation of the powerful forces of mother nature as she lashes out across San Francicso, Mexico City and Alaska, leaving a path of destruction in her wake. Journey also into the Earth to discover why these tragedies occur and why they will continue. This CD ROM also explores areas such as tsunamis and geysers, faults and folds, and quake science, thus providing a useful teaching tool to any study of earth science.

results.creator_credit: Chuck Eyler, Jacolyn Kildare and Heaping Teaspoon Animation

results.title: Earth, fire and water
results.creator_credit: Fred Richardson, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Documentary examination of Australian natural disasters. People are interviewed about their experiences in floods, bushfires, cyclones etc. Emergency services personnel give advice about the best way to prevent and cope with disasters

results.title: East Timor: birth of a nation
results.creator_credit: Andrew Sully, Luigi Acquisto, Stella Zammataro and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In 1974 after 460 years of Portuguese rule, Fretilin, the revolutionary front for an independent East Timor, declared independence in the small nation. Ten days later Indonesia invaded. Fretilin and the resistance army fought the Indonesian military over the next 24 years, with over 250,000 people dying as a result of the occupation. In 1999, the East Timorese people voted overwhelmingly for independence, but as the Indonesian army and local militia withdrew, chaos ensued, razing the country to the ground. This two-part documentary recounts incredible stories from East Timor after the country is reborn as an independent nation. Episode one: Rosas story is about a young widow and mother of six, living in abject poverty with her children scattered in various orphanages. She saves for the fare to reunite her family for the first time expressing her hope for their future. Episode two: Lu Olos story is about a man who survived twenty years in the armed resistance. Having accepted an elevated rank, Lu Olo faces the difficulties in transitioning from guerilla fighter to politician.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Sully, Luigi Acquisto, Stella Zammataro and Film Australia

results.title: East of the moon. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Marc Evans, Joy Whitby, Grasshopper, Sianel 4 Cymru and Sudwestfunk
results.brief_description: The witch and the rainbow cat is the story of Rose, a young girl on an outing to the country with her parents. Rose enters a mysterious wood in which she discovers a strange little house full of bric-a-brac and curiosities. A stuffed cat watches her as she sees her reflection in a mirror which shows her what she will look like in the future. When the owner of the house arrives - a wizened old witch - she is told that she will have to be the witch’s servant for the rest of her life. The stuffed cat comes to life and offers to help Rose if she can solve a riddle. She manages to escape and rejoins her parents who laugh at her story. “The sea tiger” is the story of a tiger who tells the most outrageous lies and how his animal friends in the jungle try to put a stop to it. This video also includes the song “Think before you speak”, written by Neil Innes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc Evans, Joy Whitby, Grasshopper, Sianel 4 Cymru and Sudwestfunk
